alert.note: Alert for Winnebago (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 31 at 3:19PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following area, Winnebago. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Rock River may rise out of its banks flooding residential property and streets along the river. Localized water level fluctuations are also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - River ice spotters and river gauges indicate a developing ice jam on the Rock River between Bauer Parkway and Latham Road near Machesney Park. Localized flooding may develop quickly along the river if ice jam worsens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
